analyzed: atas prabhavāt
translated: Because of this origin.

original: ata eva hi vaidikācchabdādevādikaṃ jagatprabhavati /🔽nanu janmādyasya yataḥ bra / / /
analyzed: atas eva hi vaidikāt śabdāt eva ādikam jagat prabhavati  nanu janma ādyasya yatas
translated: For from this very Vedic sound, the beginningless world originates.

analyzed: iti atra brahma prabhava tvam jagataḥ
translated: But is it not determined in the beginning of the Brahmasutra that the world has Brahman as its source?

analyzed: katham iha śabda prabhava tvam ucyate
translated: How is its origin from sound being stated here?

analyzed: apica yadi nāma vaidikāt śabdāt asya prabhavaḥ bhyupagataḥ
translated: Moreover, if its origin from the Vedic sound is accepted,

original: kathametāvatā virodhaḥ śabde parihṛtaḥ yāvatā vasavo rudrā ādityā viśvedevā maruta ityeter'thā anityā evotpattimattvāt /
analyzed: katham etāvatā virodhaḥ śabde parihṛtaḥ yāvatā vasavaḥ rudrāḥ ādityāḥ viśvedevāḥ marutaḥ iti etā īrthāḥ anityāḥ eva utpattimat tvāt
translated: How is this contradiction in the word avoided by this much? As long as the meanings of these words, Vasus, Rudras, Adityas, Vishvadevas, and Maruts, are indeed impermanent, because they possess origination.

original: tadanityatve ca tadvācināṃ vaidikānāṃ vasvādiśabdānāmanityatvaṃ kena nivāryate /
analyzed: tad anitya tve ca tad vācinām vaidikānām vasu ādi śabdānām anitya tvam kena nivāryate
translated: And if they are impermanent, by what is the impermanence of the Vedic words Vasu etc. which denote them, prevented?

original: prasiddhaṃ hi loke devadattasya putra utpanne yajñadatta iti tasya nāma kriyata iti /
analyzed: prasiddham hi loke devadattasya putre utpanne yajñadattaḥ iti tasya nāma kriyate iti
translated: For it is well-known in the world that when Devadatta's son is born, his name is given as Yajnadatta.

original: tasmādvirodha eva śabda iti cet / na /
analyzed: tasmāt virodhaḥ eva śabdaḥ iti ced na
translated: Therefore, if it is argued that there is indeed a contradiction in the word, it is not so.

analyzed: gavā ādi śabda artha saṃbandha nitya tva darśanāt  nahi gavā ādi vyaktīnām utpattimat tve tad ākṛtīnīm api utpattimat tvam syāt
translated: Because the eternality of the relation between the word and its meaning is seen in the case of words like 'go' (cow).🔽For, when the individual cows etc. possess origination, their forms also would not possess origination.

analyzed: dravya guṇa karmaṇām hi vyaktayaḥ eva utpadyante na ākṛtayaḥ
translated: For, the individual substances, qualities and actions alone originate, not their forms.

analyzed: ākṛtibhiḥ ca śabdānām saṃbandhaḥ na vyaktibhiḥ
translated: And the relation of words is with the forms, not with the individuals.

analyzed: vyaktīnām ānantyāt saṃbandha grahaṇa anupapatteḥ
translated: Because it is impossible to apprehend the relation due to the infinitude of individuals.

analyzed: vyaktiṣu utpadyamānāsu api ākṛtīnām nitya tvāt ca go ādi śabdeṣu kaścid virodhaḥ dṛśyate
translated: And even when the individuals are originating, no contradiction is seen in the words 'go' etc. due to the eternality of the forms.

original: tathā devādivyaktiprabhavābhyupagame 'pyākṛtinityatvānna kaścidvasvādiśabdeṣu virodha iti draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: tathā deva ādi vyakti prabhava abhyupagame pi ākṛti nitya tvāt na kaścid vasu ādi śabdeṣu virodhaḥ iti draṣṭavyam
translated: And so, even if we admit the origin of the individual gods, &c., the doctrine of the eternity of the species does not conflict with the use of the words Indra, &c,

analyzed: ākṛti viśeṣaḥ tu deva ādīnām mantra arthavāda ādibhyaḥ vigrahavat tva ādi avagamāt avagantavyaḥ
translated: The special species of the gods, &c, we must conclude from mantras, Arthavadas, &c, to be embodied beings, and so on

analyzed: sthāna viśeṣa saṃbandha nimittāḥ ca indra ādi śabdāḥ senāpatya ādi śabda vat
translated: The words Indra, &c, are connected with particular places, just as the words general, &c, are connected with particular persons

original: tataśca yo yastattatsthānamadhirohati sa sa indrādiśabdairabhidhīyata iti na doṣo bhavati /
analyzed: tatas ca yaḥ yaḥ tat tat sthānam adhirohati sa saḥ indra ādi śabdaiḥ abhidhīyate iti na doṣaḥ bhavati
translated: And thus there is no objection to the doctrine that he who occupies a particular place is called by the corresponding word Indra, &c

analyzed: naca idam śabda prabhava tvam brahma prabhava tva vat upādānakāraṇa abhiprāyeṇa ucyate
translated: Nor is the origin of the world from words to be understood in the same way as the origin of the world from Brahman, as depending on the primary cause, the material cause

original: kathaṃ tarhi sthite vācakātmanā nitye śabde nityārthasaṃbandhini śabdavyavahārayogyārthavyaktiniṣpattirataḥ prabhava ityucyate kathaṃ punaravagamyate
analyzed: katham tarhi sthite vācaka ātmanā nitye śabde nitya artha saṃbandhini śabda vyavahāra yogya artha vyakti niṣpattiḥ atas prabhavaḥ iti ucyate katham punar avagamyate
translated: But how is it to be understood? The world originates from words, because the eternal word, which is the means of communicating the meaning, and is connected with an eternal meaning, produces the manifestation of the meaning which is fit to be communicated by the word

analyzed: śabdāt prabhavati jagat iti
translated: How do we know that the world originates from words?

analyzed: pratyakṣa anumānābhyām
translated: From perception and inference

analyzed: pratyakṣam śrutiḥ
translated: Perception is the Veda

analyzed: prāmāṇyam prati anapekṣa tvāt
translated: because it is independent with regard to its authority

analyzed: anumānam smṛtiḥ
translated: Inference is Smṛti

analyzed: prāmāṇyam prati sāpekṣa tvāt
translated: Because it depends on something else for its validity.

original: te hi śabdapūrvo sṛṣṭiṃ darśayataḥ /🔽'ete iti vai prajāpatirdevānasṛjatāsṛgramiti manuṣyānindava iti pitṛṃstiraḥ pavitramiti grahānāśava iti stotraṃ viśvānīti śastramabhisaubhagetyanyāḥ
analyzed: te hi sṛṣṭim darśayataḥ  ete iti vai prajāpatiḥ devān asṛjata asṛgram iti manuṣyān indavaḥ iti pitṛn tiras pavitram iti grahān āśavaḥ iti stotram viśvāni iti śastram abhi saubhaga iti anyāḥ
translated: For they show creation preceded by sound.

analyzed: prajāḥ iti śrutiḥ
translated: The Śruti says: Prajāpati created the gods with the word 'ete', the humans with 'asṛk', the ancestors with 'indava', the cups with 'tiraḥpavitra', the praise with 'āśava', the oblations with 'viśvāni', and other beings with 'abhisaubhaga'.🔽Similarly, elsewhere also, in the Brāhmaṇa, it is said:

original: tathānyatrāpi 'sa manasā vācaṃ mithunaṃ samabhavat' bṛ / / /
analyzed: tathā anyatra api sa manasā vācam mithunam samabhavat bṛ
translated: That [Prajāpati] became united with mind and speech.

analyzed: ityādinā tatra tatra śabda pūrvikā sṛṣṭiḥ śrāvyate
translated: In this way, creation preceded by sound is heard in various places.🔽The Smṛti also says:

analyzed: smṛtiḥ api anādinidhanā nityā vāc utsṛṣṭā svayaṃbhuvā
translated: That eternal, beginningless and endless speech was emitted by the Self-existent One.

original: ādau vedamayī divyā yataḥ sarvā pravṛttayaḥ' //
analyzed: ādau veda mayī divyā yatas sarvā pravṛttayaḥ
translated: In the beginning, it was divine and full of the Vedas, from which all activities proceed.

analyzed: iti
translated: This is the Smṛti.

analyzed: utsargaḥ u pi ayam vācaḥ saṃpradāya pravartana ātmakaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: This emission of speech should be seen as consisting in the propagation of the tradition.

original: anādinidhanāyā anyādṛśasyotsargasyāsaṃbhavāt /🔽tathā 'nāma rūpaṃ ca bhūtānāṃ karmaṇāṃ ca pravartanam /🔽vedaśabdebhya evādau nirmame sa maheśvaraḥ' //
analyzed: anādinidhanāyāḥ anyādṛśasya utsargasya asaṃbhavāt  tathā nāma rūpam ca bhūtānām karmaṇām ca pravartanam  veda śabdebhyaḥ eva ādau nirmame sa maheśvaraḥ
translated: Because it is not possible for an eternal, beginningless and endless speech to have any other kind of emission.🔽Similarly, in the Manu Smṛti:🔽That great Lord first created from the words of the Veda, the names and forms of beings and the activity of actions.

analyzed: manu iti
translated: This is the Smṛti.

original: ' sarveṣāṃ tu sa nāmāni karmāṇi ca pṛthakpṛthak /
analyzed: sarveṣām tu sa nāmāni karmāṇi ca pṛthak pṛthak
translated: 'But he made the names and the actions of all separately,

analyzed: veda śabdebhyaḥ eva ādau pṛthak saṃsthāḥ ca nirmame
translated: and also the different institutions, from the words of the Veda, in the beginning.'

analyzed: iti ca
translated: And so on.

original: apica cikīrṣitamarthamanutiṣṭhaṃstasya vācakaṃ śabdaṃ pūrvaṃ smṛtvā paścāttamarthamanuṣṭhatīti sarveṣāṃ naḥ pratyakṣametat /
analyzed: apica cikīrṣitam artham anutiṣṭhan tasya vācakam śabdam pūrvam smṛtvā paścāt tam artham anuṣṭhati iti sarveṣām naḥ pratyakṣam etat
translated: Moreover, it is directly perceived by all of us that one who performs the intended action first remembers the word that denotes it and then performs that action.

original: tathā prajāpaterapi sraṣṭuḥ sṛṣṭeḥ pūrvaṃ vaidikāḥ śabdā manasi prādurbabhūvuḥ /
analyzed: tathā prajāpateḥ api sraṣṭuḥ sṛṣṭeḥ pūrvam vaidikāḥ śabdāḥ manasi prādurbabhūvuḥ
translated: In the same way, it is understood that before creation, the Vedic words appeared in the mind of Prajapati, the creator.

analyzed: paścāt tad anugatān arthān sasarja iti gamyate
translated: And afterwards he created the objects corresponding to them.

original: tathāca śrutiḥ 'sa bhūriti vyāhāratsa bhūmimasṛjata' tai /brā / / / /
analyzed: tathā ca śrutiḥ sa bhūḥ iti vyāhārat sa bhūmim asṛjata taibrā
translated: And thus the Śruti says: 'He uttered the word bhūḥ. He created the earth.' (Tai. Āraṇyaka 2.1.1.1)

original: ityevamādikā bhūrādiśabdebhya eva manasi prādurbhūtebhyo bhūrādilokānsṛṣṭāndarśayati /
analyzed: iti evamādikā bhūḥ ādi śabdebhyaḥ eva manasi prādurbhūtebhyaḥ bhūḥ ādi lokān sṛṣṭān darśayati
translated: In this and other passages, it shows that the worlds such as earth were created from the words such as bhūḥ that appeared in the mind.

analyzed: kimātmakam punar śabdam abhipretya idam śabda prabhava tvam ucyate
translated: But what kind of sound is meant when it is said that this (universe) originates from sound?

analyzed: sphoṭam iti āha
translated: He says it is the sphoṭa.

original: varṇapakṣe hi teṣāmutpannapradhvaṃsitvānnityebhyaḥ śabdebhyo devādivyaktīnāṃ prabhava ityanupapannaṃ syāt /
analyzed: varṇa pakṣe hi teṣām utpanna pradhvaṃsi tvāt nityebhyaḥ śabdebhyaḥ deva ādi vyaktīnām prabhavaḥ iti anupapannam syāt
translated: For if (the origin of the universe from sound is explained) on the theory of (sound consisting of) letters, it would be illogical to say that the individual gods and so on originate from eternal sounds, because (the letters) arise and perish.

analyzed: utpanna dhvaṃsinaḥ ca varṇāḥ
translated: And the letters are produced and destroyed.

analyzed: pratyuccāraṇam anyathā ca anyathā ca pratīyamāna tvāt
translated: Because they are perceived differently each time they are uttered.

original: tathāhi adṛśyamāno 'pi puruṣaviśeṣo 'dhyayanadhvaniśravaṇādeva viśeṣato nirdhāryate devadatto 'yamadhīte yajñadatto 'yamadhīte iti /
analyzed: tathā hi adṛśyamānaḥ pi puruṣa viśeṣaḥ dhyayana dhvani śravaṇāt eva viśeṣataḥ nirdhāryate devadattaḥ yam adhīte yajñadattaḥ yam adhīte iti
translated: For instance, a particular person, even when not seen, is specifically determined by hearing the sound of his recitation: This is Devadatta reciting, This is Yajnadatta reciting.

analyzed: na ca ayam varṇa viṣayaḥ nyathātva pratyayaḥ mithyājñānam
translated: And this cognition of difference regarding letters is not false knowledge.

analyzed: bādhaka pratyaya abhāvāt  na ca varṇebhyaḥ ṛtha avagatiḥ yuktā
translated: Because there is no contradictory cognition.🔽And the understanding of meaning from letters is not proper.

analyzed: na hi ekaikaḥ varṇa ūrtham pratyāyayet
translated: For not a single letter would convey the meaning,

analyzed: vyabhicārāt
translated: because of deviation.

analyzed: na ca varṇa samudāya pratyayaḥ sti
translated: And there is no cognition of a collection of letters.

analyzed: kramavat tvāt varṇānām
translated: Because letters have a sequence.

analyzed: pūrva pūrva varṇa anubhava janita saṃskāra sahitaḥ ntyaḥ varṇa ūrtham pratyāyayiṣyati iti yadi ucyeta
translated: If it is said that the final letter, along with the impressions produced by the experience of each preceding letter, will convey the meaning,

analyzed: tat na
translated: that is not so.

original: saṃbandhagrahaṇāpekṣo hi śabdaḥ svayaṃ pratīyamānor'thaṃ pratyāyayeddhūmādivat /
analyzed: saṃbandha grahaṇa apekṣaḥ hi śabdaḥ svayam pratīyamāna ūrtham pratyāyayet dhūma ādi vat
translated: For a word, which requires the apprehension of its relation, conveys the meaning when it is itself cognized, like smoke and so on.

analyzed: na ca pūrva pūrva varṇa anubhava janita saṃskāra sahitasya antya varṇasya pratītiḥ asti
translated: And there is no cognition of the final letter along with the impressions produced by the experience of each preceding letter.

analyzed: a pratyakṣa tvāt saṃskārāṇām
translated: Because the embellishments are not directly perceived.

original: kāryapratyāyitaiḥ saṃskāraiḥ sahito 'ntyo varṇorthaṃ pratyāyayiṣyatīti cet / na /
analyzed: kārya pratyāyitaiḥ saṃskāraiḥ sahitaḥ ntyaḥ varṇa ūrtham pratyāyayiṣyati iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the final letter, along with the embellishments inferred from their effects, will convey the meaning, that is not so.

analyzed: saṃskāra kāryasya api smaraṇasya krama varti tvāt
translated: Because memory, which is the effect of the embellishments, also occurs in sequence.

analyzed: tasmāt sphoṭaḥ eva śabdaḥ
translated: Therefore, the word is only a sphoṭa.

original: sa caicaikavarṇapratyayāhitasaṃskārabīje 'ntyavarṇapratyayajanitapari pāke pratyayinyekapratyayaviṣayatayā jhaṭiti pratyavabhāsate /
analyzed: sa ca e ca eka varṇa pratyaya āhita saṃskāra bīje pāke pratyayini eka pratyaya viṣaya tayā jhaṭiti pratyavabhāsate
translated: And that appears suddenly as the object of a single cognition in the cognizer, whose seed is the impression produced by the cognition of each letter, and which is ripened by the cognition of the final letter.

analyzed: na ca ayam eka pratyayaḥ varṇa viṣayā smṛtiḥ
translated: And this single cognition is not memory with letters as its object.

analyzed: varṇānām aneka tvāt eka pratyaya viṣaya tva anupapatteḥ
translated: Because the letters are many, it is not possible for them to be the object of a single cognition.

analyzed: tasya ca pratyuccāraṇam pratyabhijñāyamāna tvāt nitya tvam
translated: And because it is recognized as the same on each utterance, it is eternal.

analyzed: bheda pratyayasya varṇa viṣaya tvāt
translated: Because the cognition of difference has letters as its object.

analyzed: tasmāt nityāt śabda sphoṭa rūpāt abhidhāyakāt kriyā kāraka phala lakṣaṇam jagat abhidheya bhūtam prabhavati iti
translated: Therefore, the world consisting of action, means and result, which is the denoted object, originates from the eternal word-sphoṭa, which is the denotative.

original: varṇā eva tu na śabdaḥ iti bhagavānupavarṣaḥ /🔽nanūtpannapradhvaṃsitvaṃ varṇānmuktaṃ / tanna /
analyzed: varṇāḥ eva tu na śabdaḥ iti bhagavān upavarṣaḥ 🔽nanu utpannapradhvaṃsi tvam varṇāt muktam tat na
translated: But the revered Upamanyu says that the letters themselves are not the word.🔽But it has been said that the letters are produced and destroyed. That is not so.

analyzed: te eva iti pratyabhijñānāt
translated: Because of the recognition that they are the same.

analyzed: sādṛśyāt pratbhijñānam keśa ādiṣu iva iti ced na
translated: If it be said that the recognition is due to similarity, as in the case of the hair, etc.,—no (says the siddhāntin).

analyzed: pratyabhijñānasya pramāṇa antareṇa bādhā anupapatteḥ
translated: Because the recognition is not annulled by any other means of knowledge.

analyzed: pratyabhijñānam ākṛti nimittam iti ced na
translated: If it be said that the recognition is due to the universal,—no (says the siddhāntin).

analyzed: vyakti pratyabhijñānāt
translated: Because the recognition is of the individual.

original: yadi hi pratyuccāraṇaṃ gavādivyaktivadanyā anyā varṇavyaktayaḥ pratīyeraṃstata ākṛtinimittaṃ pratyabhijñānaṃ syāt /
analyzed: yadi hi pratyuccāraṇam gavā ādi vyakti vat anyāḥ anyāḥ varṇa vyaktayaḥ pratīyeran tatas ākṛti nimittam pratyabhijñānam syāt
translated: If the individual letters were recognised as different on each utterance, as in the case of the individual cows, then the recognition would be due to the universal.

analyzed: na tu etat asti
translated: But this is not the case.

analyzed: varṇa vyaktayaḥ eva hi pratyuccāraṇam pratyabhijñāyante
translated: For the individual letters are recognised on each utterance.

original: dvirgośabda uccārita iti hi pratipattirna tu dvau gośabdāviti /
analyzed: dvis go śabdaḥ uccāritaḥ iti hi pratipattiḥ na tu dvau go śabdau iti
translated: The idea is that the word 'cow' has been uttered twice, not that two 'cows' have been uttered.

original: nanu varṇā apyuccāraṇabhedena bhinnaḥ pratīyante devadattayajñadattayoradhyayanadhvaniśravaṇādeva bhedapratīterityuktam /
analyzed: nanu varṇāḥ api uccāraṇa bhedena bhinnaḥ pratīyante devadatta yajñadattayoḥ adhyayana dhvani śravaṇāt eva bheda pratīteḥ iti uktam
translated: But it has been argued that the letters are recognised as different on account of the difference in the utterance, as is evident from the hearing of the recitation of Devadatta and Yajñadatta.

original: atrābhidhīyate sati varṇaviṣaye niścite pratyabhijñāne saṃyogavibhāgābhivyaṅgyatvādvarṇānāmabhivyañjakavaicitryanimitto 'yaṃ varṇaviṣayo vicitraḥ 🔽pratyayo na svarūpanimittaḥ /
analyzed: atra abhidhīyate sati varṇa viṣaye niścite pratyabhijñāne saṃyoga vibhāga abhivyaṅgya tvāt varṇānām abhivyañjaka vaicitrya nimittaḥ yam varṇa viṣayaḥ vicitraḥ  pratyayaḥ na sva rūpa nimittaḥ
translated: To this we reply: When the recognition of the letters is certain, the various cognitions regarding the letters are due to the variety of manifesters, because the letters are manifested by conjunctions and disjunctions, and not due to the intrinsic nature of the letters.

analyzed: apica varṇa vyakti bheda vādinā api pratyabhijñāna siddhaye varṇa ākṛtayaḥ kalpayitavyāḥ
translated: Moreover, even one who asserts the difference of individual letters must imagine the universal forms of letters in order to establish recognition.

analyzed: tāsu ca para upādhikaḥ bheda pratyayaḥ iti abhyupagantavyam
translated: And it must be accepted that the cognition of difference in those [universals] is due to external factors.

original: tadvaraṃ varṇavyaktiṣveva paropādhiko bhedapratyayaḥ svarūpanimittaṃ ca pratyabhijñānamiti kalpanālāghavam /
analyzed: tat varam varṇa vyaktiṣu eva para upādhikaḥ bheda pratyayaḥ svarūpa nimittam ca pratyabhijñānam iti kalpanā lāghavam
translated: It is better to assume that the cognition of difference regarding the individual letters is due to external factors, and that recognition is based on their intrinsic nature. This way there is less assumption.

original: eṣa eva ca varṇaviṣayasya bhedapratyayasya bādhakaḥ pratyayo yatpratyabhijñānam /
analyzed: eṣaḥ eva ca varṇa viṣayasya bheda pratyayasya bādhakaḥ pratyayaḥ yat pratyabhijñānam
translated: And this very recognition is the cognition that contradicts the cognition of difference regarding the letters.

original: kathaṃ hyekasminkālaṃ bahūnāmuccārayatāmeka eva sangakāro yugapadanekarūpaḥ syāt /
analyzed: katham hi ekasmin kālam bahūnām uccārayatām ekaḥ eva san gakāraḥ yugapad aneka rūpaḥ syāt
translated: For how could a single letter ga be of many forms simultaneously when uttered by many people at the same time?

analyzed: udāttaḥ ca anudāttaḥ ca svaritaḥ ca sa anunāsikaḥ ca niranunāsikaḥ ca iti
translated: It would be accented, unaccented, circumflexed, nasal, and non-nasal.

original: athavā dhvanikṛto 'yaṃ pratyayabhedo na varṇakṛta ityadoṣaḥ /
analyzed: athavā dhvani kṛtaḥ yam pratyaya bhedaḥ na varṇa kṛtaḥ iti adoṣaḥ
translated: Or, this distinction of the suffixes is due to the sound, not to the letters, so there is no fault.

original: kaḥ punarayaṃ dhvanirnāma /🔽yo dūrādākarṇayato varṇavivekamapratipadyamānasya karṇapathamavatarati /
analyzed: kaḥ punar ayam dhvaniḥ nāma  yaḥ dūrāt ākarṇayataḥ varṇa vivekam a pratipadyamānasya karṇa patham avatarati
translated: What, then, is this thing called sound?🔽That which, when heard from a distance, does not convey the discrimination of the letters, enters the ear.

analyzed: pratyāsīdataḥ ca paṭu maṭu tva ādi bhedam varṇeṣu āsañjayati
translated: And as it approaches, it imparts the distinction of acute, grave, etc. to the letters.

analyzed: tad nibandhanāḥ ca udātta ādayaḥ viśeṣāḥ na varṇa svarūpa nibandhanāḥ
translated: And the distinctions such as acute, etc. are based on that, not on the nature of the letters themselves.

analyzed: varṇānām pratyuccārāṇam pratyabhijñāyamāna tvāt
translated: Because the letters are recognized as the same even when pronounced differently.

original: evañca sati sālambanā udāttādipratyayā bhaviṣyanti /🔽itaradhā hi varṇānāṃ pratyabhijñāyamānānāṃ nirbhedatvātsaṃyogavibhāgakṛtā udāttādiviśeṣāḥ kalperan /
analyzed: evam ca sati sa ālambanāḥ udātta ādi pratyayāḥ bhaviṣyanti  itaradhā hi varṇānām pratyabhijñāyamānānām nirbheda tvāt saṃyoga vibhāga kṛtāḥ udātta ādi viśeṣāḥ kalperan
translated: And if this is so, the notions of acute, etc. will have an object.🔽For otherwise, since the letters are recognized as the same without distinction, the distinctions such as acute, etc. would be supposed to be due to conjunctions and disjunctions.

original: saṃyogavibhāgānāṃ cāpratyakṣatvācca tadāśrayā viśeṣā varṇeṣvadhyavasituṃ śakyanta ityato nirālambanā evaita udāttādipratyayāḥ syuḥ /
analyzed: saṃyoga vibhāgānām ca apratyakṣa tvāt ca tad āśrayāḥ viśeṣāḥ varṇeṣu adhyavasitum śakyante iti atas nirālambanāḥ eva ete udātta ādi pratyayāḥ syuḥ
translated: And since the conjunctions and disjunctions are not perceptible, the distinctions based on them cannot be ascertained in the letters. Therefore, these notions of acute, etc. would be without an object.

original: apica naivaitadabhiniveṣṭavyamudāttādibhedena varṇānāṃ pratyabhijñāyamānānāṃ bhedo bhavediti /
analyzed: apica na eva etat abhiniveṣṭavyam udātta ādi bhedena varṇānām pratyabhijñāyamānānām bhedaḥ bhavet iti
translated: Moreover, it should not be insisted that the recognition of the sounds as udātta, etc. would imply their difference.

analyzed: na hi anyasya bhedena anyasya a bhidyamānasya bhedaḥ bhavitum arhati
translated: For the difference of one thing cannot be implied by the difference of another thing which is not itself different.

analyzed: nahi vyakti bhedena jātim bhinnām manyante
translated: For people do not regard a universal as different because its individual manifestations are different.

original: varṇebhyaścārthapratīteḥ saṃbhavātsphoṭakalpanānarthikā /🔽na kalpayāmyahaṃ sphoṭaṃ pratyakṣameva tvenamavagacchāmi /
analyzed: varṇebhyaḥ ca artha pratīteḥ saṃbhavāt sphoṭa kalpanā anarthikā  na kalpayāmi aham sphoṭam pratyakṣam eva tu enam avagacchāmi
translated: And since the cognition of the meaning is possible from the letters, the postulation of a sphoṭa is useless.

original: ekaikavarṇagrahaṇāhitasaṃskārāyāṃ buddhau jhaṭiti pratyava ūbhāsanāditi cet / na /
analyzed: ekaika varṇa grahaṇa āhita saṃskārāyām buddhau jhaṭiti pratyavaḥ ū bhāsanāt iti ced na
translated: If it be said that “I do not postulate a sphoṭa; I perceive it directly, because it is immediately manifested in the cognition in which the impressions left by the cognitions of the individual letters are revived”,—that is not so.

analyzed: asyāḥ api buddheḥ varṇa viṣaya tvāt
translated: Because this cognition also has the letters for its object.

analyzed: ekaika varṇa grahaṇa uttara kālā hi iyam ekā buddhiḥ gauḥ iti samasta varṇa viṣayā na artha antara viṣayā
translated: For this one cognition which appears after the cognitions of the individual letters, and has for its object the entire set of letters, viz., ‘go’, does not have for its object anything different (from the letters).

analyzed: katham etat avagamyate
translated: How is this known?

original: yato 'syāmapi buddhau gakārādayo varṇā anuvartante natu dakārādayaḥ /
analyzed: yatas syām api buddhau gakāra ādayaḥ varṇāḥ anuvartante na tu dakāra ādayaḥ
translated: Because in this cognition also the letters ‘ga’ and the rest continue, and not the letters ‘da’ and the rest.

original: yadi hyasyā buddhergakārādibhyor'thāntaraṃ sphoṭo viṣayaḥ syāttato dakārādaya iva gakārādayo 'pyasyā buddhervyāvarteran /
analyzed: yadi hi asyāḥ buddheḥ gakāra ādibhyaḥ artha antaram sphoṭaḥ viṣayaḥ syāt tatas dakāra ādayaḥ iva gakāra ādayaḥ pi asyāḥ buddheḥ vyāvarteran
translated: For if the sphoṭa were the object of this cognition, which is different from the g sound, etc., then the g sound, etc., like the d sound, would be excluded from this cognition.

analyzed: na tu tathā asti
translated: But it is not so.

analyzed: tasmāt iyam eka buddhiḥ varṇa viṣayā eva smṛtiḥ
translated: Therefore, this single cognition is only a memory of the letters.

analyzed: nanu aneka tvāt varṇānām na eka buddhi viṣaya tā upapadyate iti uktam
translated: But it was said that because the letters are many, they cannot be the object of a single cognition.

analyzed: tat pratibrūmaḥ saṃbhavati anekasya api eka buddhi viṣaya tvam
translated: We reply: It is possible for many things to be the object of a single cognition.

original: paṅ ktirvanaṃ senā daśa śataṃ sahasramityādidarśanāt /
analyzed: paṅ ktiḥ vanam senā daśa śatam sahasram ityādi darśanāt
translated: Because we see examples like a clump, a forest, an army, ten, a hundred, a thousand, etc.

original: yā tu gaurityeko 'yaṃ śabda iti buddhiḥ /
analyzed: yā tu gauḥ iti ekaḥ yam śabdaḥ iti buddhiḥ
translated: But the cognition this is the single word 'cow'

analyzed: sā bahuṣu eva varṇeṣu eka artha avaccheda nibandhanā aupacārikī vana senā ādi buddhi vat eva
translated: is a figurative usage based on the exclusion of multiple meanings in many letters, like the cognition of a forest, an army, etc.

original: atrāha yadi varṇā eva sāmastyenaikabuddhiviṣayatāmāpadyamānāḥ padaṃ syustato jārā rājā kapiḥ pikaḥ ityādiṣu padaviśeṣapratipattirna syāt /
analyzed: atra āha yadi varṇāḥ eva sāmastyena eka buddhi viṣaya tām āpadyamānāḥ padam syuḥ tatas jārāḥ rājā kapiḥ pikaḥ ityādiṣu pada viśeṣa pratipattiḥ na syāt
translated: Here it is said: If the letters themselves, when becoming the object of a single cognition, were to be the word, then the understanding of specific words like jar, king, monkey, cuckoo, etc. would not occur.

original: ta eva hi varṇā itaratra cetaratra ca pratyavabhāsanta iti /
analyzed: te eva hi varṇāḥ itaratra ca itaratra ca pratyavabhāsante iti
translated: Because those very same letters appear in one place and in another.

original: atra vadāmaḥ satyapi samastavarṇapratyavamarśe yathā kramānurodhinya eva pipīlikāḥ paṅ ktibuddhimārohanti /
analyzed: atra vadāmaḥ sati api samasta varṇa pratyavamarśe yathā krama anurodhinyaḥ eva pipīlikāḥ paṅ kti buddhim ārohanti
translated: To this we reply: Even though there is a cognition of all the letters, just as ants form the idea of a line in accordance with the order,

analyzed: evam krama anurodhane eva varṇāḥ pada buddhim ārokṣyanti
translated: in the same way, the letters will produce the idea of a word in accordance with the order.

analyzed: tatra varṇānām aviśeṣe pi krama viśeṣa kṛtā pada viśeṣa pratipattiḥ na virudhyate
translated: Even though there is no difference among the letters, the cognition of a particular word produced by a particular order is not contradictory.

original: vṛddhavyavahāre ceme varṇāḥ kramādyanugṛhītā gṛhītārthaviśeṣasaṃbandhāḥ santaḥ svavyavahāro
analyzed: vṛddha vyavahāre ca ime varṇāḥ krama ādi anugṛhītāḥ gṛhīta artha viśeṣa saṃbandhāḥ santaḥ sva vyavahāraḥ
translated: And these letters, favored by order etc. in the usage of the elders, having the connection with the particular meaning grasped,

analyzed: pi ekaika varṇa grahaṇa anantaram samasta pratyavamarśinyām buddhau tādṛśāḥ eva pratyavabhāsamānāḥ tam
translated: even in one's own usage, appearing in the cognition that cognizes all the letters after the apprehension of each letter,

analyzed: tam artham avyabhicāreṇa pratyāyayiṣyanti iti varṇa vādinaḥ laghīyasī kalpanā
translated: will undoubtedly convey that meaning. Thus for the proponents of letters, the assumption is less cumbersome.

analyzed: sphoṭa vādinaḥ tu dṛṣṭa hāniḥ adṛṣṭa kalpanā ca
translated: But for the proponents of sphoṭa, there is the abandoning of the seen and the assumption of the unseen.

original: varṇāśceme krameṇa gṛhyamāṇāḥ sphoṭaṃ vyañjayanti sa sphoṭor'thaṃ vyanaktīti garīyasī kalpanā syāt /
analyzed: varṇāḥ ca ime krameṇa gṛhyamāṇāḥ sphoṭam vyañjayanti sa sphoṭaḥ ūrtham vyanakti iti garīyasī kalpanā syāt
translated: The assumption would be more cumbersome if it were that these letters, when apprehended in order, manifest the sphoṭa, and that sphoṭa manifests the meaning.

analyzed: atha api nāma pratyuccāraṇam anye nye varṇāḥ syuḥ
translated: Even if, on the other hand, the letters were different with each utterance,

original: tathāpi pratyabhijñālambanabhāvena varṇasāmānyānāmavaśyābhyupagantavyatvādyā varṇeṣvarthapratipādanaprakriyā racitā sā sāmānyeṣu saṃcārayitavyā
analyzed: tathā api pratyabhijñā ālambana bhāvena varṇa sāmānyānām avaśya abhyupagantavya tvāt yā varṇeṣu artha pratipādana prakriyā racitā sā sāmānyeṣu saṃcārayitavyā
translated: Still, because the universals of letters must be necessarily accepted as the basis of recognition, the process of conveying meaning through letters should be extended to universals.

original: tataśca nityebhyaḥ śabdebhyo devādivyaktīnāṃ prabhava ityaviruddham // //
analyzed: tatas ca nityebhyaḥ śabdebhyaḥ deva ādi vyaktīnām prabhavaḥ iti aviruddham
translated: And thus, the origination of individual gods etc. from eternal words is not contradictory.

analyzed: autpattikam svābhāvikam
translated: The natural is innate.

original: vasutvādijātivācakācchabdāttajjātīyāṃ cikīrṣitāṃ vyakti buddhāvālikhya tasyāḥ prabhavanaṃ /
analyzed: vasu tva ādi jāti vācakāt śabdāt tad jātīyām cikīrṣitām vyakti buddhau ālikhya tasyāḥ prabhavanam
translated: From a word denoting the universal of being a Vasu, the individual of that class which is desired is drawn into the mind, and its origination is brought about.

analyzed: tat idam tad prabhava tvam
translated: This is that origination.

analyzed: ākṛtīnām jātīnām
translated: Of the forms, the universals.

analyzed: ete asṛgram indavaḥ tiras pavitram āśavaḥ
translated: These swift Soma juices have been pressed through the purifying filter,

original: viśvānyabhisaubhagā' iti /🔽etanmantrasthaiḥ padaiḥ smṛtvā brahmā devādīnasṛjata /
analyzed: viśvāni abhisaubhagāḥ iti  etat mantra sthaiḥ padaiḥ smṛtvā brahmā deva ādīn asṛjata
translated: For all good fortune.🔽Brahmā created the gods and others by remembering them with the words in this mantra.

original: tatra saṃnihitavācakaitacchabdo devānāṃ karaṇeṣvanugrāhakatvena saṃnihitānāṃ smārakaḥ /
analyzed: tatra saṃnihita vācaka etad śabdaḥ devānām karaṇeṣu anugrāhaka tvena saṃnihitānām smārakaḥ
translated: There, the word 'this', which denotes what is present, reminds us of the gods who are present as aids to the sense organs.

analyzed: asṛk rudhiram tad pradhāna deha ramaṇāt manuṣyāṇām agra śabda smārakaḥ
translated: The word 'first' reminds us of humans, who are the enjoyers of bodies in which blood is predominant.

analyzed: candra sthānām pitṛṇām indu śabdaḥ smārakaḥ
translated: The word 'moon' reminds us of the ancestors who reside in the moon.

original: pavitraṃ somaṃ svāntavistaraskurvatāṃ grahāṇāṃ tiraḥpavitraśabdaḥ smārakaḥ /
analyzed: pavitram somam sva anta vistaraskurvatām grahāṇām tiras pavitra śabdaḥ smārakaḥ
translated: The word 'tiras' (across) in the expression 'tiras-pavitra' (across the strainer) is a reminder to those who are spreading out the Soma-strainers for the cups.

original: ṛ / / /ucośnuvatāṃ stotrāṇāmāśuśabdaḥ stotrānantaraṃ prayogaṃ viśatāṃ śastrāṇāṃ viśvaśabdaḥ /
analyzed: ṛucā uśnuvatām stotrāṇām āśu śabdaḥ stotra anantaram prayogam viśatām śastrāṇām viśva śabdaḥ
translated: The word 'āśu' (quickly) is a reminder to the Stotras (hymns) that are to be performed quickly, and the word 'viśva' (all) is a reminder to the Śastras (formulas) that are to be used immediately after the Stotras.

analyzed: saṃpradāyaḥ guru śiṣya paraṃparā adhyayanam
translated: The tradition is the study passed down through a series of teachers and students.

analyzed: saṃsthāḥ avasthāḥ
translated: The states are the stages.

analyzed: varṇa rūpam tad atirikta sphoṭa rūpam vā iti kim śabda arthaḥ
translated: The meaning of the word 'kiṃ' (what) is whether it has the form of letters or the form of a sphoṭa (sphota) apart from that.

original: sphuṭate varṇairvyajyata iti sphoṭo varṇābhivyaṅgyor'thastasya vyañjako gavādiśabdo nityastamabhipretyedamucyata iti pūrveṇānvayaḥ /
analyzed: sphuṭate varṇaiḥ vyajyate iti sphoṭaḥ varṇa abhivyaṅgyaḥ arthaḥ tasya vyañjakaḥ gavādi śabdaḥ nityaḥ tam abhipretya idam ucyate iti pūrveṇa anvayaḥ
translated: A sphoṭa is that which is manifested by letters. The word 'go' (cow) etc. which manifests that meaning is eternal. With reference to that, this is said. The connection is with the previous sentence.

analyzed: vyabhicārāt ekasmāt varṇāt artha pratīti adarśanāt varṇa antara vaiyarthya pratīti adarśanāt ca iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is because of the fallacy and because of the non-observation of the understanding of meaning from a single letter, and because of the non-observation of the understanding from another letter.

original: ekaiketi yathā ratnatattvaṃ bahubhiścākṣuṣapratyayaiḥ sphuṭaṃ bhāsate tathā gavādipadasphoṭo
analyzed: ekaikā iti yathā ratna tattvam bahubhiḥ cākṣuṣa pratyayaiḥ sphuṭam bhāsate tathā gavādi pada sphoṭaḥ
translated: Just as the truth of a gem shines clearly through many visual perceptions, in the same way, the sphoṭa of the word 'go' (cow) etc.

original: gakārādyekaikavarṇakṛtapratyayaiḥ sphoṭaviṣayairāhitāḥ saṃskārā bījaṃ yasmin citte
analyzed: gakāra ādi ekaika varṇa kṛta pratyayaiḥ sphoṭa viṣayaiḥ āhitāḥ saṃskārāḥ bījam yasmin citte
translated: In the mind in which the impressions created by the cognitions produced by each letter such as 'ga' etc. which are the seeds of the sphoṭa are deposited,

original: tasmin antyavarṇakṛtapratyayena janitaḥ paripāko 'ntyaḥ saṃskāro yasminpratyayini
analyzed: tasmin antya varṇa kṛta pratyayena janitaḥ paripākaḥ ntyaḥ saṃskāraḥ yasmin pratyayini
translated: The final impression produced by the final letter in the mind that is the substratum of the impression,

original: citte ekaṃ gauriti padamiti pratyayaḥ pratyakṣastadviṣayatayā spaṣṭamavabhāsata ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: citte ekam gauḥ iti padam iti pratyayaḥ pratyakṣaḥ tad viṣaya tayā spaṣṭam avabhāsate iti arthaḥ
translated: the cognition of the word 'one cow' is a direct perception, the meaning being that it appears clearly as having that as its object.

original: vapanānantaraṃ ta eveme keśā iti dhīrbhrāntiriti yuktam /
analyzed: vapana anantaram te eva ime keśāḥ iti dhīḥ bhrāntiḥ iti yuktam
translated: It is proper to say that the cognition 'these are the same hairs' after shaving is erroneous.

analyzed: bheda dhī virodhāt
translated: Because it is contradicted by the cognition of difference.

analyzed: tālu ādi deśaiḥ koṣṭha stha vāyu saṃyoga vibhāgābhyām vicitrābhyām vyaṅgya tvāt varṇeṣu vaicitrya dhīḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the cognition of variety in letters is due to their being denoted by the various conjunctions and disjunctions of the air in the throat produced by the palate etc.

original: yo 'vatarati sa dhvaniriti śeṣaḥ /🔽varṇātiriktaḥ śabdaḥ dhvanirityarthaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ vatarati sa dhvaniḥ iti śeṣaḥ  varṇa atiriktaḥ śabdaḥ dhvaniḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The remainder is 'that which descends is the sound'.🔽The meaning is that sound is a word that is different from letters.

original: pratyuccāraṇaṃ varṇā anuvartante dhvanirvyāvartata iti bhedaḥ /
analyzed: pratyuccāraṇam varṇāḥ anuvartante dhvaniḥ vyāvartate iti bhedaḥ
translated: The difference is that the letters occur in every utterance, while the sound varies.

original: apratyakṣatvaṃ aśrāvaṇatvam /🔽yathā khaṇḍamuṇḍādiviruddhānekavyaktiṣvabhinnaṃ gotvaṃ tathā dhvaniṣu varṇā abhinnā evetyarthaḥ /
analyzed: apratyakṣa tvam aśrāvaṇa tvam  yathā khaṇḍa muṇḍa ādi viruddha aneka vyaktiṣu abhinnam go tvam tathā dhvaniṣu varṇāḥ abhinnāḥ eva iti arthaḥ
translated: Being imperceptible means being inaudible.🔽The meaning is that just as cowness is undifferentiated in the many individual cows that are mutually contradictory, such as spotted and bald, in the same way, the letters are undifferentiated in the sounds.

analyzed: udātta ādiḥ dhvaniḥ tad bhedena hetunā varṇānām api iti yojanā
translated: The construction is: by the difference of sound, which is udātta etc., the letters also are different.

analyzed: niścayaḥ
translated: The ascertainment of meaning is the determination of the meaning.

analyzed: pratyavamarśaḥ smṛtiḥ
translated: Recollection is the recognition.

analyzed: vyutpatti daśā vṛddha vyavahāraḥ
translated: The stage of learning is the usage of the elders.

analyzed: kramāt iti ādi śabdena saṃkhyā gṛhyate
translated: By 'etc.' number is included.

analyzed: sva sva vyavahāraḥ madhyama vṛddhasya pravṛtti avasthā
translated: One's own usage is the stage of activity of the middle-aged person.🔽Being like that means being aided by the seen order etc. in the stage of learning.

analyzed: dṛṣṭam varṇānām artha bodhaka tvam
translated: The seen is the power of letters to convey meaning.

analyzed: adṛṣṭaḥ sphoṭaḥ
translated: The unseen is the sphoṭa.

analyzed: karmaṇi avirodham aṅgīkṛtya śabda prāmāṇya virodham āśaṅkya pariharati
translated: Accepting the non-contradiction in the case of action, he raises the doubt of contradiction in the validity of words and answers it.

analyzed: śabdaḥ iti ced iti
translated: If it is argued that it is a word,

analyzed: mā prasañji prasaktaḥ mā bhūt nāma iti arthaḥ
translated: the meaning is that let there be no contradiction, let it not be so.

original: autpattikasūtre śabdārthayoranādyoḥ saṃbandhasyānāditvādvedasya svārthe mānāntarānapekṣatvena prāmāṇyamuktam /
analyzed: autpattikasūtre śabda arthayoḥ anādyoḥ saṃbandhasya anādi tvāt vedasya svārthe māna antara anapekṣa tvena prāmāṇyam uktam
translated: In the aphorism on the natural relation, it is said that the Veda is valid with regard to its own meaning without depending on another means of knowledge, because the beginningless relation of word and meaning is beginningless.

analyzed: idānīm anitya vigraha vyakti abhyupagame tad saṃbandhasya api anitya tvāt māna antareṇa vyaktim
translated: Now, if the manifestation of the eternal form is accepted, then because the relation is also non-eternal, the manifestation should be known by another means of knowledge,

original: jñātvā śabdasya saṃketaḥ puṃsā kartavya iti mānāntarāpekṣatvātprāmāṇyasya virodhaḥ
analyzed: jñātvā śabdasya saṃketaḥ puṃsā kartavyaḥ iti māna antara apekṣa tvāt prāmāṇyasya virodhaḥ
translated: and the convention of the word should be made by a person. Thus, because of the dependence on another means of knowledge, there would be a contradiction in validity.

analyzed: syāt iti āha katham ityādinā
translated: He says this with 'How?' etc.

analyzed: kim śabdānām anitya tayā saṃbandhasya kārya tvam āpadyate
translated: Is it that the relation becomes an effect due to the impermanence of the words?

analyzed: uta arthānām anitya tayā
translated: Or is it due to the impermanence of the meanings?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ iti āha na ayam api iti
translated: He says that the first is not so, with This is not so.

analyzed: karmaṇi avirodha vat iti apeḥ arthaḥ
translated: The meaning of like the non-contradiction in the case of action is also.

analyzed: deva ādi vyakti hetutvena prāk eva śabdānām sattvāt na anitya tvam iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the words already exist as the cause of the individualities of gods etc., so they are not impermanent.

analyzed: atra pūrva apara virodham śaṅkate nanu iti
translated: Here he doubts the contradiction between the previous and the later with But surely.

original: śabdasya nimittatvena brahmasahakāritvādavirodha ityāśaṅkya dvitīyaṃ kalpamutthāpayatiapiceti /
analyzed: śabdasya nimitta tvena brahma sahakāri tvāt avirodhaḥ iti āśaṅkya dvitīyam kalpam utthāpayati api ca iti
translated: Fearing that there is no contradiction because Brahman is a co-operative cause of the word as a means, he raises the second alternative with Moreover.

analyzed: anitya tvam sa ādi tvam
translated: Impermanence means being produced.

analyzed: vyakti rūpa arthānām anitya tayā śabdānām saṃbandhasya anitya tvam durvāram
translated: It is unavoidable that the relation of the words becomes impermanent due to the impermanence of the meanings in the form of individualities.

analyzed: tasmāt pauruṣeya saṃbandha sāpekṣa tvāt prāmāṇya virodhaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that there is a contradiction with the validity being dependent on a human relation.

original: naca vyaktināmanityatve 'pi ghaṭatvādijātisamavāyavacchabdasaṃbandho 'pi nityaḥ syāditi vācyaṃ /
analyzed: naca vyaktinām anitya tve pi ghaṭa tva ādi jāti samavāya vat śabda saṃbandhaḥ pi nityaḥ syāt iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that even when the individualities are impermanent, the relation of the word would be permanent, like the inherence of the universal potness etc.

analyzed: ubhaya āśrita saṃbandhasya anyatara abhāve sthiti ayogena dṛṣṭānta asidveḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the relation dependent on both cannot remain when one of them is absent, so the example is not established.

original: yathā gotvādayo gavādiśabdavācyāstathā vasutvādyākṛtayo vasvādiśabdārthā na vyaktya iti pariharatinetyādinā /
analyzed: yathā go tva ādayaḥ gavā ādi śabda vācyāḥ tathā vasu tva ādi ākṛtayaḥ vasu ādi śabda arthāḥ na vyaktyaḥ iti pariharati na ityādinā
translated: He answers No and so on.

original: śabdānāṃ tadarthānāṃ jātīnāṃ ca nityatvāttatsaṃbandho 'pi nitya iti pratipādayatinahītyādinā /
analyzed: śabdānām tad arthānām jātīnām ca nitya tvāt tad saṃbandhaḥ api nityaḥ iti pratipādayati nahi ityādinā
translated: He shows that the relation is also eternal because the words, their meanings, and the universals are eternal, with For words etc.

analyzed: vyakti nāma ānantyāt iti
translated: Due to the infinite number of individuals means

original: naca gotvāvacchedena vyaktiṣu śaktiḥ sugraheti vācyaṃ /
analyzed: naca go tva avacchedena vyaktiṣu śaktiḥ sugrahā iti vācyam
translated: It cannot be said that the power with respect to individuals is easily grasped by way of the restriction of being a cow.

original: sāmānyasyāpratyāsattitvena sarvavyaktyupasthityabhāvāt /🔽gotvaṃ śakyatāvacchedakamiti grahāpekṣayā gotvaṃ śakyamiti lāghavāt /
analyzed: go tvam śakya tā avacchedakam iti graha apekṣayā go tvam śakyam iti lāghavāt
translated: Because the universal is not a proximate cause, all individuals are not present.🔽Because it is easier to grasp that being a cow is the qualifier of what is possible by saying being a cow is possible than by saying being a cow is the qualifier that restricts what is possible.

analyzed: nirūḍha ajahat lakṣaṇayā vyakteḥ lābhena anya labhya tva abhāvāt ca iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that because the individual is obtained by the primary figurative meaning that does not abandon the literal meaning, there is no being obtained by something else.

analyzed: yat vā kevala vyaktiṣu śaktiḥ atra nirasyate
translated: Or, here only the power with respect to individuals alone is refuted.
The knowledge of inconsistency.

analyzed: vinā eva vyakteḥ śabda śakti āyatta jāti jñāna viṣaya tvena ubhaya śakteḥ āvaśyaka tvāt
translated: Because, even without the individual, the universal must be known by the power of the word, both powers are necessary.

analyzed: tathāca nitya jāti tādātmyena vyakteḥ anādi tvāt tad saṃbandhaḥ pi anādiḥ
translated: And thus, because the individual is beginningless by way of identity with the eternal universal, its relation is also beginningless.

analyzed: satkārya vādāt
translated: Because of the doctrine of satkāryavāda.

original: ata eva vākyavṛttau tattvamasyādivākye bhāgalakṣaṇoktā yujyate /
analyzed: atas eva vākya vṛttau tattvamasi ādi vākye bhāga lakṣaṇa uktā yujyate
translated: For this very reason, the definition of a part in the case of sentences like 'tat tvam asi' is appropriate in the Vakyavritti.
Because when only the universal is denoted, the indivisible meaning cannot be a part of what is denoted.

analyzed: atas prabhavāt iti sūtra svārasyāt ca kevala vyakti śakti nirāsaḥ iti gamyate
translated: And from the natural meaning of the sutra 'atah prabhavat' (it is understood that) the negation of the mere individual's power is implied.

original: kevalavyaktivacanāḥ khalu ḍitthādiśabdā arthānantarabhāvinaḥ sāṃketikāḥ gavādiśabdāstu🔽vyaktiprabhavahetutvena prāgevasandhīti na vyaktimātravacanāḥ sāṃketikāḥ kintu sthūlasūkṣmabhāvenānusyūtavyaktyavinābhūtasāmānyavacanā iti
analyzed: kevala vyakti vacanāḥ khalu ḍittha ādi śabdāḥ artha anantara bhāvinaḥ sāṃketikāḥ go ādi śabdāḥ tu  vyakti prabhava hetu tvena prāk eva sandhi iti na vyakti mātra vacanāḥ sāṃketikāḥ kintu sthūla sūkṣma bhāvena anusyūta vyakti avinābhūta sāmānya vacanāḥ iti
translated: For words like 'dittha' etc. which denote only individuals are conventional, appearing after the object, while words like 'go' etc.🔽are not conventional denoters of individuals alone, but of universals which are inseparable from the individuals that are connected by grossness and subtlety.

analyzed: na ca indra ādi vyakteḥ ekatvena jāti abhāvāt ākāśa śabda vat indra candra ādi śabdaḥ kevala vyakti vacanāḥ iti sāṃpratam
translated: And it is not right to say that words like 'indra', 'chandra' etc. denote only individuals like Indra, the moon etc., because there is no universal due to the oneness of the individual like Indra etc., like the word 'akasa' (space).

analyzed: atīta anāgata vyakti bhedena jāti upapatteḥ iti alam prapañcena
translated: Because the universal is possible due to the difference of individuals in the past and future. Enough of this elaboration.

analyzed: dṛṣṭāntam upasaṃhṛtya dārṣṭāntikam āha vyaktiṣu ityādinā ākṛtiḥ jātiḥ
translated: Having concluded the example, he applies it to the case in point by saying 'in individuals' etc. 'Akriti' is universal.

analyzed: nanu kā sā vyaktiḥ
translated: But what is that individual?

analyzed: yat anugata indra tva ādi jātiḥ śabda arthaḥ syāt iti atas āha ākṛti viśeṣaḥ tu iti
translated: If the universal of Indra-ness etc. were the meaning of words, then it would be as stated. To this he says: But the universal is the specific property.

analyzed: vajrahastaḥ purandaraḥ ityādibhyaḥ iti arthaḥ  indra ādi śabdānām jātiḥ indra ādiṣu pravṛtti nimittam iti uktvā upādhi nimittam āha sthāna iti
translated: The meaning is from statements like 'Vajra-handed Purandara'.🔽Having stated that the universal is the reason for the application of words like Indra to Indra etc., he states the reason based on the secondary meaning: The place etc.

analyzed: vyakti pralaye pi sthānasya sthāyi tvāt śabda artha saṃbandha nitya tā iti atas āha tatas ca iti
translated: Even when the individuals are destroyed, the place remains, so the connection between word and meaning is eternal. To this he says: And from that etc.

analyzed: uktam pūrva apara virodham pariharati na ca iti
translated: He resolves the contradiction between the earlier and later statements: And this is not etc.

analyzed: śabdaḥ nimittam iti avirodham matvā sūtra śeṣam avatārayati katham punar iti
translated: Considering that there is no contradiction in saying that the word is the reason, he introduces the remainder of the sutra: How then etc.

analyzed: smṛtyā sva prāmāṇya artham mūlaśrutiḥ anumīyate iti anumānam smṛtiḥ
translated: Memory is inference, because it infers the original Vedic text for the sake of its own validity.

original: 'ete asṛgramindavastiraḥ pavitramāśavaḥ /🔽viśvānyasyābhisaubhagā /🔽'ityetanmantrasthaiḥ padaiḥ smṛtvā brahmā devādīnasṛjat /
analyzed: ete asṛgram indavaḥ tiras pavitram āśavaḥ  viśvāni asya abhisaubhagā  iti etat mantra sthaiḥ padaiḥ smṛtvā brahmā deva ādīn asṛjat
translated: 'These Soma juices have flowed through the strainer, swift,🔽bringing all good fortune to him.'🔽Brahma created the gods etc. by remembering with these words in the mantra.

analyzed: tatra ete iti padam sarvanāma tvāt devānām smārakam
translated: There, the word 'these' reminds of the gods because it is a pronoun.

original: asṛgrudhiraṃ tatpradhāne dehe ramanta iti asṛgrā manuṣyāḥ /
analyzed: asṛj rudhiram tad pradhāne dehe ramante iti asṛj rāḥ manuṣyāḥ
translated: Humans delight in the body which has blood as its main constituent, so they are 'asrigdhas'.

original: candrasthānāṃ pitṛṇāṃ induśabdaḥ smārakaḥ /🔽pavitraṃ somaṃ svāntastiraskurvatāṃ grahāṇāṃ tiraḥ pavitraśabdaḥ /
analyzed: candra sthānām pitṛṇām indu śabdaḥ smārakaḥ  pavitram somam su antar tiraskurvatām grahāṇām tiras pavitra śabdaḥ
translated: The word 'moon' is a reminder of the manes occupying the place of the moon.🔽The word 'through the strainer' is for the cups that hide the pure Soma within themselves.

analyzed: ṛcaḥ śruvatām stotrāṇām gīti rūpāṇām āśu śabdaḥ
translated: The word 'quickly' is for the Rikas, the hymns in the form of songs, that are offered into the fire.

analyzed: ṛci adhyūḍham sāma eti śruteḥ
translated: Because of the Vedic text 'The Saman is based on the Rik'.

analyzed: stotra anantaram prayogam viśatām śāstrāṇām viśva śabdaḥ
translated: The word 'all' is for the scriptures that enter into practice after the hymns.

analyzed: sarvatra saubhāgya yuktānām abhisaubhaga śabdaḥ smārakaḥ iti chandoga brāhmaṇa vākya arthaḥ
translated: The word 'auspicious' is a reminder of all that is associated with good fortune. This is the meaning of the Chhandogya Brahmana text.

original: sa prajāpatirmanasā vācaṃ trayīṃ mithunaṃ samabhavat manovāgrūpaṃ mithunaṃ saṃbhāvitavān /
analyzed: sa prajāpatiḥ manasā vācam trayīm mithunam samabhavat manaḥ vāc rūpam mithunam saṃbhāvitavān
translated: That Prajapati became a couple with the mind and the three Vedas. He brought about a couple in the form of mind and speech.

analyzed: manasā trayī prakāśitām sṛṣṭim ālocitavān iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that he mentally conceived the creation illuminated by the three Vedas.

analyzed: raśmiḥ iti eva ādityam asṛjata eti ādi śrutiḥ ādi śabda arthaḥ
translated: The meaning of the word 'etc.' in the Vedic text 'He created the sun as the ray' and so on.

analyzed: saṃpradāyaḥ guru śiṣya paramparā adhyayanam
translated: Tradition is the study through the succession of teachers and students.

analyzed: saṃsthāḥ avasthāḥ
translated: States are conditions.

analyzed: yā prajāpati sṛṣṭiḥ sā śabda pūrvikā
translated: That creation of Prajapati is preceded by sound.

analyzed: sṛṣṭi tvāt
translated: Because it is a creation.

analyzed: pratyakṣa ghaṭa ādi vat iti pratyakṣa anumānābhyām iti asya ārta antaram āha api ca iti
translated: Like a pot etc. that are directly perceived. This is the meaning of 'by perception and inference'. Another meaning is stated by 'Moreover'.

analyzed: atas prabhava tva prasaṅgāt śabda svarūpam vaktum uktam ākṣipati kimātmakam iti
translated: Therefore, due to the non-occurrence of the origin, he asks What is its nature? in order to state the nature of sound.

analyzed: varṇa rūpam tad atirikta sphoṭa rūpam vā iti kim śabda arthaḥ
translated: The meaning of the word what is whether it has the form of letters or the form of sphoṭa apart from that.

original: tatra varṇānāmanityatvātsphoṭasya cāsattvānna jagaddhetutvamityākṣepe dvitīyapakṣaṃ vaiyākaraṇo gṛhṇātisphoṭamiti /
analyzed: tatra varṇānām anitya tvāt sphoṭasya ca asattvāt na jagat hetutvam iti ākṣepe dvitīya pakṣam vaiyākaraṇaḥ gṛhṇāti sphoṭam iti
translated: There, since letters are impermanent and sphoṭa is non-existent, it is not the cause of the world. When this objection is raised, the grammarian accepts the second view, saying sphoṭa.

original: sphuṭyate varṇairvyajyata iti sphoṭovarṇābhivyaṅgyor'thastasya vyañjako gavādiśabdo nityastamabhipretyedamucyata iti pūrveṇānvayaḥ /
analyzed: sphuṭyate varṇaiḥ vyajyate iti sphoṭaḥ varṇa abhivyaṅgyaḥ arthaḥ tasya vyañjakaḥ gavādi śabdaḥ nityaḥ tam abhipretya idam ucyate iti pūrveṇa anvayaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is said in connection with the previous statement that the eternal word such as go which manifests the sphoṭa, which is manifested by the letters, is intended.

original: sa evādyapakṣaṃ dūṣayativarṇeti /🔽so 'yaṃ gakāra iti pratyabhijñayā varṇanityatvasiddhernānupapattirityata āhautpanneti /
analyzed: saḥ eva ādya pakṣam dūṣayati varṇa iti  saḥ yam gakāraḥ iti pratyabhijñayā varṇa nitya tva siddheḥ na anupapattiḥ iti atas āha utpanna iti
translated: He himself refutes the first view, saying letters.🔽Since the eternality of letters is established by recognition as this is the letter 'ga', there is no inconsistency. To this he says when produced.

original: tāratvamandratvādiviruddhadharmavattvena tāro gakāro mandro gakāra iti pratīyamānagakārasya bhedānumānātpratyabhijñāgatvajātiviṣayetyarthaḥ
analyzed: tāra tva mandra tva ādi viruddha dharmavat tvena tāraḥ gakāraḥ mandraḥ gakāraḥ iti pratīyamāna gakārasya bheda anumānāt pratyabhijñā ga tva jāti viṣayā iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that since the letter ga which is cognized as the letter 'ga' is high and the letter 'ga' is low is inferred to be different due to having contradictory properties such as highness and lowness, the recognition is with regard to the universal ga.

original: nanu viruddhadharmajñānaṃ dhvanyupādhikaṃ bhrama ityata āhanaceti /
analyzed: nanu viruddha dharma jñānam dhvani upādhikam bhramaḥ iti atas āha na ca iti
translated: But the cognition of contradictory properties is a delusion due to the superimposition of sound. To this he says 'and yet'.

original: tathāca varṇānāmanityatvānna jagaddhetutvamiti bhāvaḥ kiñca teṣāmarthabodhakatvāyogātsphoṭo 'ṅgīkārya ityāhanaca varṇebhya ityādinā /
analyzed: tathāca varṇānām anitya tvāt na jagat hetutvam iti bhāvaḥ kiñca teṣām artha bodhaka tva ayogāt sphoṭaḥ ṅgīkāryaḥ iti āha na ca varṇebhyaḥ ityādinā
translated: And thus, because of the impermanence of the letters, they cannot be the cause of the world. This is the idea. Moreover, because they cannot convey meaning, the sphoța must be accepted. He says 'and yet the meaning is not understood from the letters' and so on.

analyzed: vyabhicārāt ekasmāt varṇāt artha pratīti adarśanāt
translated: Because of the fallacy of over-extension, and because the meaning is not seen to be understood from a single letter,

analyzed: varṇa antara vaiyarthya prasaṅgāt ca iti arthaḥ
translated: and because it would lead to the uselessness of other letters. This is the meaning.

original: tarhi varṇānāṃ samudāyo bodhaka ityāśaṅkya kṣaṇikānāṃ sa nāstītyāhanaceti /
analyzed: tarhi varṇānām samudāyaḥ bodhakaḥ iti āśaṅkya kṣaṇikānām sa na asti iti āha na ca iti
translated: Then, if it is suspected that the collection of letters is what conveys the meaning, he says 'and yet the collection is not possible' because they are momentary.

original: varṇānāṃ svataḥ sāhityābhāve 'pi saṃskāralakṣaṇāpūrvadvārā sāhityamāgneyādiyāgānāmiveti śaṅkatepūrveti /
analyzed: varṇānām svatas sāhitya abhāve pi saṃskāra lakṣaṇa apūrva dvārā sāhityam āgneya ādi yāgānām iva iti śaṅkate pūrva iti
translated: Even if there is no natural association of the letters, there is association through the antecedent called impression, just as in the case of the Agniṣṭoma and other sacrifices. This is suspected in 'the antecedent'.

analyzed: kim ayam saṃskāraḥ varṇaiḥ janitaḥ pūrva ākhyaḥ kaścid
translated: Is this impression called 'apūrva' produced by the letters?

analyzed: uta varṇa anubhava janitaḥ bhāvanā ākhyaḥ
translated: Or is it called 'bhāvanā' produced by the experience of the letters?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ māna abhāvāt
translated: Not the first, because there is no evidence.

analyzed: kiñca ayam ajñātaḥ jñātaḥ vā artha dhī hetuḥ
translated: Moreover, is this impression the cause of the cognition of meaning when unknown, or when known?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ iti āha tat na iti
translated: He says 'that is not so' to reject the first.

analyzed: saṃskāra sahitaḥ śabdaḥ jñātaḥ eva artha dhī hetuḥ
translated: A word accompanied by impression is the cause of the cognition of meaning only when known.

analyzed: saṃbandha grahaṇam apekṣya bodhaka tvāt
translated: Because it is a means of knowing, in dependence on the apprehension of the relation.

analyzed: dhūma ādi vat iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is like smoke etc.

original: dvitīye kiṃ pratyakṣeṇa jñāta uta kāryaliṅgena /
analyzed: dvitīye kim pratyakṣeṇa jñātaḥ uta kārya liṅgena
translated: In the second case, is it known by perception or by the inferential mark of effect?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ iti āha na ca iti
translated: He rejects the first by saying and that is not so.

analyzed: dvitīyam śaṅkate kāryā iti
translated: He raises the doubt about the second by saying effect.

original: kāryamarthadhīstasyāṃ jātāyāṃ saṃskārapratyayaḥ tasmiñjāte seti parasparāśrayeṇa dūṣayatineti /
analyzed: kāryam artha dhīḥ tasyām jātāyām saṃskāra pratyayaḥ tasmin jāte sā iti paraspara āśrayeṇa dūṣayati na iti
translated: When the cognition of the object arises from that, the impression is the condition. When that arises, it is so. He criticizes it as a mutual dependence by saying no.

original: padārthasmaraṇasyāpi padajñānāntarabhāvitvāttena saṃskārasahitāntyavarṇātmakapadasya jñānaṃ na yuktamityakṣarārthaḥ /
analyzed: padārtha smaraṇasya api pada jñāna antara bhāvi tvāt tena saṃskāra sahita antya varṇa ātmaka padasya jñānam na yuktam iti akṣara arthaḥ
translated: The meaning of the word is that the recollection of the meaning of a word also exists after the knowledge of the word, so the knowledge of the word consisting of the final letter along with the impression is not proper.

analyzed: api śabdaḥ paraspara āśraya dyotana arthaḥ
translated: The word also is to indicate mutual dependence.

analyzed: etena nirastaḥ  tasya varṇa smṛti mātra hetu tvena artha dhī hetu tva ayogāt
translated: By this, the theory of impression as the cause of existence is also rejected.🔽Because it is not proper for it to be the cause of the cognition of the object, being only the cause of the recollection of the letter.

analyzed: na ca antya varṇa sāhityāt artha dhī hetu tvam
translated: And it cannot be said that the cognition of the object is caused by the final letter along with the impression.

analyzed: kevala saṃskārasya tu varṇa smṛti hetu tvam iti vācyam
translated: But it must be said that the impression alone is the cause of the recollection of the letter.

analyzed: artha dhī pūrva kāle bhāvanāyāḥ jñāna abhāvena artha dhī hetu tva ayogāt
translated: And it is not proper for it to be the cause of the cognition of the object, because there is no knowledge of the impression at the time before the cognition of the object.

analyzed: na ca varṇa smaraṇena anumitā sā antya varṇa sahita artha dhī hetuḥ iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that it is inferred from the recollection of the letters, and that it is the cause of the cognition of the meaning along with the final letter.

analyzed: tad kāryasya kramikasya varṇa smaraṇasya api antya varṇa anubhava anantara bhāvi tvena tena anumita bhāvanānām antya varṇa sāhitya abhāvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that the recollection of the letters, which is the effect of that [inference], also occurs after the experience of the final letter, and therefore the inferred cognition does not have the final letter along with it.

analyzed: varṇānām artha bodhaka tva saṃbhave phalam āha tasmāt iti
translated: When it is possible for the letters to convey the meaning, he states the result [of the inference] as therefore.

original: sphoṭe 'pi kiṃ mānamityāśaṅkyaikaṃ padamiti pratyakṣapramāṇamityāhasa ceti /
analyzed: sphoṭe pi kim mānam iti āśaṅkya ekam padam iti pratyakṣa pramāṇam iti āha sa ca iti
translated: Fearing that someone might ask What is the evidence for the sphoṭa?, he says that the evidence is perception, [namely] the cognition this is one word.

original: yathā ratnatattvaṃ bahubhiścākṣuṣapratyayaiḥ sphuṭaṃ bhāsate tathā gavādipadasphoṭo
analyzed: yathā ratna tattvam bahubhiḥ cākṣuṣa pratyayaiḥ sphuṭam bhāsate tathā gavādi pada sphoṭaḥ
translated: Just as the true nature of a gem shines forth clearly through many visual perceptions, in the same way, the sphoṭa of the word cow etc.,

original: gakāradyekaikavarṇakṛtapratyayaiḥ sphoṭaviṣayairāhitāḥ saṃskārā bījaṃ yasmin citte
analyzed: gakāra di ekaika varṇa kṛta pratyayaiḥ sphoṭa viṣayaiḥ āhitāḥ saṃskārāḥ bījam yasmin citte
translated: is the seed in that mind in which the impressions created by the perceptions produced by each letter such as ga etc., which have the sphoṭa as their object.

analyzed: tasmin antya varṇa kṛta pratyayena janitaḥ paripākaḥ ntyaḥ saṃskāraḥ yasmin tasmin pratyayini
translated: In that mind of the person who has the final impression, which is the final ripening produced by the perception produced by the final letter,

original: citte ekaṃ gauritipadamiti pratyayaḥ pratyakṣastadviṣayatayā spaṣṭamavabhāsata ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: citte ekam gauḥ iti padam iti pratyayaḥ pratyakṣaḥ tad viṣaya tayā spaṣṭam avabhāsate iti arthaḥ
translated: the perception this is one word 'cow' is perception, and it shines forth clearly as having that [sphoṭa] as its object. This is the meaning.

analyzed: anena varṇa anvaya vyatirekayoḥ sphoṭa jñāne nyathā siddhiḥ
translated: By this (verse) it is shown that the concomitance and non-concomitance of the letters with the cognition of the sphoṭa are otherwise established.

analyzed: na ca ekasmāt varṇāt samyak sphoṭa abhivyaktiḥ
translated: And the sphoṭa is not properly manifested from a single letter.

original: yena varṇāntaravaiyarthyaṃ kintu ratnavadbahupratyayasaṃskṛte citte samyaksphoṭābhivyaktirityuktaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: yena varṇa antara vaiyarthyam kintu ratna vat bahu pratyaya saṃskṛte citte samyak sphoṭa abhivyaktiḥ iti uktam bhavati
translated: By which there would be the uselessness of other letters. But it is said that the proper manifestation of the sphoṭa occurs in the mind that is refined by many conditions, like a jewel.

analyzed: nanu eka padam ekam vākyam iti pratyayaḥ pada vākya sphoṭayoḥ na pramāṇam
translated: Now, the notion that a single word is a single sentence is not a means of valid knowledge regarding the sphoṭas of words and sentences.

analyzed: tasya varṇa samūha ālambana smṛti tvāt iti āśaṅkya niṣedhati na ca iti
translated: Because it is a memory that has as its object a collection of letters. Suspecting this, he refutes it with not so.

analyzed: sphoṭasya jagat hetu tva artham nitya tvam āhatasya ca iti
translated: In order to establish that the sphoṭa is the cause of the world, he says that it is eternal with and that.

analyzed: nanu tat eva idam padam iti pratyabhijñā bhramaḥ
translated: Now, the recognition that this is that very word is a delusion.

analyzed: udātta ādi bheda pratyayāt iti atas āha bheda iti
translated: Because of the cognition of the difference in accentuation, etc. Therefore he says difference, etc.

analyzed: ācārya saṃpradāya ukti pūrvakam siddhāntayati varṇāḥ eva iti
translated: He establishes the conclusion preceded by the statement of the teacher's tradition with the letters themselves.

analyzed: varṇa atirikta sphoṭa ātmaka śabdasya anubhava anārohāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the sound in the form of the sphoṭa, which is apart from the letters, does not ascend to experience.

analyzed: sādṛśya doṣāt iyam bhrāntiḥ iti śaṅkate sādṛśyāt iti
translated: He suspects that this is a delusion due to similarity and error with similarity, etc.

original: vapanānantaraṃ ta eveme keśā iti dhīrbhrāntiriti yuktaṃ /
analyzed: vapana anantaram te eva ime keśāḥ iti dhīḥ bhrāntiḥ iti yuktam
translated: It is proper to say that the cognition these are those very hairs after shaving is a delusion.

analyzed: bheda dhī virodhāt
translated: Because it contradicts the cognition of difference.

original: sa evāyaṃ varṇa iti dhīstu pramaiva /
analyzed: saḥ eva ayam varṇaḥ iti dhīḥ tu pramā eva
translated: But the cognition this is the same letter is indeed valid cognition.

analyzed: bādhaka abhāvāt iti āhana iti
translated: Because there is no sublating cognition, he says: No.

analyzed: go tva ādi pratyabhijñā vat varṇeṣu pratyabhijñā gavādi viṣayā iti śaṅkate pratyabhijñānam iti
translated: He doubts that the recognition of letters is like the recognition of cowness, etc., with cows as the object, saying Recognition.

analyzed: vyakti bhede siddhe pratyabhijñāyāḥ jāti viṣaya tvam syāt
translated: If the difference of individuals is established, recognition could have the universal as its object.

original: yattvayā pītaṃ jalaṃ tadeva mayā pītamityādau /
analyzed: yat tvayā pītam jalam tat eva mayā pītam iti ādau
translated: As in the water you drank is the same water I drank, etc.

original: na tatheha vyaktibhedaḥ siddha iti pariharatina /
analyzed: na tathā iha vyakti bhedaḥ siddhaḥ iti pariharati na
translated: But here the difference of individuals is not established, he replies: No.

analyzed: vyakti iti
translated: By individuals.

analyzed: na tu etat iti
translated: But this is not so.

analyzed: vyakti anya tva jñānam iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: the cognition of the difference of individuals.

analyzed: udātta tva ādi viruddha dharma tvāt vyakti bhedaḥ numāna siddhaḥ iti anuvadati nanu iti
translated: The difference of individuals is established by inference because of the presence of contradictory properties such as udātta-ness, etc., he repeats: But is it not so?

analyzed: bheda pratyayasya kumbha kūpa ākāśa bheda pratyaya vat aupādhika bheda viṣaya tvāt anyathā siddheḥ ananyathā siddha vyakti aikya pratyabhijñayā nirapekṣa svarūpa ālambanayā
translated: Because the cognition of difference has as its object the difference due to adventitious causes, like the difference of the space in a pot and a well, and is established otherwise, it is contradicted by the recognition of the oneness of individuals, which is established otherwise and has as its object their own nature, which is independent.

analyzed: bādhaḥ iti uttaram āha atra iti
translated: The answer is: Here, he says.

analyzed: tālu ādi deśaiḥ koṣṭha stha vāyu saṃyoga vibhāgābhyām vicitrābhyām vyaṅgya tvāt varṇeṣu vaicitrya dhīḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the diversity in letters is understood through the various combinations and disjunctions of the air in the throat and other places that express them.

original: kalpanāgauravācca varṇeṣu svato bhedo nāstītyāhaapiceti /🔽anantā gakārādivyaktayastāsu pratyabhijñānārthaṃ gatvādijātayastāsu codāttatvādibhedasyaupādhikatvamiti
analyzed: kalpanā gauravāt ca varṇeṣu svatas bhedaḥ na asti iti āha api ca iti  anantāḥ gakāra ādi vyaktayaḥ tāsu pratyabhijñāna artham ga tva ādi jātayaḥ tāsu ca udātta tva ādi bhedasya aupādhika tvam iti
translated: And because of the great complexity of assumptions, there is no natural difference in letters. This is what is said by Moreover.🔽The individual ga's and so on are infinite. For recognition among them, there are universals like gatva. And the difference of udātta and so on is accidental.

analyzed: kalpanāt varam varṇa vyakti bheda mātrasya aupādhika tva kalpanam iti vyakti ānantyasya jātīnām
translated: It is better to assume that the difference of individual letter is merely accidental. Thus the assumption of the infinity of individuals and

analyzed: ca kalpanam ayuktam iti arthaḥ
translated: universals is not proper. This is the meaning.

analyzed: nanu bhedasya bādhaka abhāvāt na aupādhika tvam iti atas āha eṣaḥ iti
translated: But difference is not accidental because there is no sublation of it. To this he says This.

analyzed: astu tarhi pratyaya dvaya prāmāṇyāya bheda abhedayoḥ satya tvam
translated: Let there be then the reality of difference and non-difference for the validity of the two cognitions.

analyzed: tatra āha katham hi iti
translated: To that he says How indeed.

analyzed: ubhayoḥ eka tva virodhāt bhedaḥ aupādhikaḥ eva iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that because the identity of the two is contradictory, difference is only accidental.

original: nanu vāyusaṃyogāderatīndriyatvānna tadgatavaicitryasyodāttatvādervarṇeṣu pratyakṣāropaḥ saṃbhavatītyaruciṃ vadiṣyansvamatamāhaathaveti /
analyzed: nanu vāyu saṃyoga ādeḥ atīndriya tvāt na tad gata vaicitryasya udātta tva ādeḥ varṇeṣu pratyakṣa āropaḥ saṃbhavati iti arucim vadiṣyan sva matam āha athavā iti
translated: But it may be argued that since the conjunction with air etc. are imperceptible, the diversity in them, such as elevation etc., cannot be superimposed on the letters through perception. To express his own view, he says Or else.

analyzed: dhvani dharmāḥ udātta tva ādayaḥ dhvanya bheda adhyāsāt varṇeṣu bhānti iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the properties of sound such as elevation etc. appear in the letters through the superimposition of the non-difference of sound.

analyzed: praśna pūrvakam dhvani svarūpam āhakaḥ iti
translated: He states the nature of sound by way of a question, beginning with What is that?

analyzed: avatarati sa dhvaniḥ iti śeṣaḥ
translated: The remainder is that sound descends.

analyzed: varṇa atiriktaḥ śabdaḥ dhvaniḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that sound is a word that is distinct from the letters.

analyzed: samīpam gatasya puṃsaḥ tāra tva manda tva ādi dharmān svagatān varṇeṣu saḥ eva āropayati iti āha pratyāsīdataḥ ca iti
translated: He says that when a person approaches, that [sound] superimposes its own properties such as sharpness and slowness on the letters, [saying] When approaching..., etc.

original: ādipadaṃ vivṛṇotitaditi /🔽nanvavyaktavarṇa eva dhvanirnātirikta ityata āhavarṇānāmiti /
analyzed: ādi padam vivṛṇoti tat iti  nanu avyakta varṇaḥ eva dhvaniḥ na atiriktaḥ iti atas āha varṇānām iti
translated: He explains the word etc.: That..., etc.🔽But it may be argued that sound is not distinct from the indistinct letters. To this he says The letters..., etc.

original: pratyuccāraṇaṃ varṇā anuvartante dhvanirvyāvartata iti bheda ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: pratyuccāraṇam varṇāḥ anuvartante dhvaniḥ vyāvartate iti bhedaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the difference is that the letters occur in every utterance, while the sound varies.

original: anyathā vācike jape varṇeṣvavyakteṣu dhvanibuddhiḥ syāt /
analyzed: anyathā vācike jape varṇeṣu avyakteṣu dhvani buddhiḥ syāt
translated: Otherwise, in whispered recitation when the letters are indistinct, there would be the notion of sound.

original: dundubhyādidhvanau śabdatvamātreṇa gṛhyamāṇe ayamavyakto varṇa iti dhīḥ syāditi mantavyam /
analyzed: dundubhi ādi dhvanau śabda tva mātreṇa gṛhyamāṇe ayam avyaktaḥ varṇaḥ iti dhīḥ syāt iti mantavyam
translated: When the sounds of a drum etc. are apprehended merely as sound, it should be understood that there would be the cognition this is an indistinct letter.

original: evaṃ dhvanyupādhikatve svamate guṇaṃ vadanvāyūpādhikatve pūrvoktāmaruciṃ darśayatievañcetyādinā /
analyzed: evam dhvani upādhikatve sva mate guṇam vadan vāyu upādhikatve pūrva uktām arucim darśayati evam ca ityādinā
translated: Thus, in his own view, stating the merit in the case of being qualified by sound, he shows his dislike for being qualified by air, as stated earlier, with the words and in this way.

analyzed: astu kaḥ doṣaḥ
translated: Let it be so, what is the fault?

analyzed: tatra āha saṃyoga iti
translated: There he says in the case of conjunction etc.

analyzed: vāyu saṃyoga ādeḥ aśrāvaṇa tvāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that because the conjunction with air etc. is not audible.

analyzed: tasmāt śrāvaṇa dhvaniḥ eva udātta tva ādi āropa upādhiḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: Therefore, the audible sound alone is the qualifier for the superimposition of udātta etc. This is the idea.

original: evaṃ viruddhadharmakadhvanīnāṃ bhede 'pi na teṣvanugatā varṇā bhidyanta ityuktam /
analyzed: evam viruddha dharmaka dhvanīnām bhede na teṣu anugatāḥ varṇāḥ bhidyante iti uktam
translated: Thus, it has been said that even in the case of sounds having contradictory properties, the letters that are common to them are not different.

analyzed: tat eva dṛṣṭāntena draḍhayati api ca iti
translated: He strengthens that very thing with an example, with the words Moreover.

original: yathā khaṇḍamuṇḍādiviruddhānekavyaktiṣvabhinnaṃ gotvaṃ tathā dhvaniṣu varṇā abhinnā evetyarthaḥ /
analyzed: yathā khaṇḍa muṇḍa ādi viruddha aneka vyaktiṣu abhinnam go tvam tathā dhvaniṣu varṇāḥ abhinnāḥ eva iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that just as cowness is undifferentiated in the many individual cows that are contradictory, such as spotted and bald, in the same way, the letters are undifferentiated in the sounds.

analyzed: udātta ādiḥ dhvaniḥ tad bhedena hetunā varṇānām api iti yojanā
translated: The construction is: by the difference of the sound that is udātta etc., which is the cause, even the letters are different.

analyzed: pratyabhijñā virodhāt iti akṣara arthaḥ
translated: The meaning of the words is: because it contradicts recognition.

original: yadvā udāttatvādibhedaviśiṣṭatayā pratyabhijñāyamānatvādvarṇānāṃ bheda ityāśaṅkāṃ dṛṣṭāntena nirasyatiapiceti /
analyzed: yat vā udātta tva ādi bheda viśiṣṭa tayā pratyabhijñāyamāna tvāt varṇānām bhedaḥ iti āśaṅkām dṛṣṭāntena nirasyati api ca iti
translated: Or, to remove the doubt that the letters are different because they are recognized as qualified by the difference of udātta, etc., he sets forth an example in the words Moreover, etc.

original: varṇānāṃ sthāyitvaṃ prasādhya teṣāmeva vācakatvaṃ vaktuṃ sphoṭaṃ vighaṭayativarṇebhyaśceti /
analyzed: varṇānām sthāyi tvam prasādhya teṣām eva vācaka tvam vaktum sphoṭam vighaṭayati varṇebhyaḥ ca iti
translated: Having established the permanence of the letters, in order to speak of their very being the denotators, he refutes the sphoṭa in the words And from the letters, etc.

analyzed: kalpanām asahamānaḥ āśaṅkatena iti
translated: Not accepting the assumption, he raises the doubt in the words No, etc.

original: cakṣuṣā darpaṇayuktāyāṃ buddhau mukhavacchrotreṇa varṇayuktāyāṃ buddhau vinaiva hetvantaraṃ sphoṭaḥ pratyakṣa ityāhajhaṭitīti /
analyzed: cakṣuṣā darpaṇa yuktāyām buddhau mukha vat śrotreṇa varṇa yuktāyām buddhau vinā eva hetu antaram sphoṭaḥ pratyakṣaḥ iti āha jhaṭiti iti
translated: Just as the face is perceived in the cognition connected with the mirror by the eye, so the sphoṭa is perceived in the cognition connected with the letters by the ear, without any other cause. He says Immediately, etc.

original: yasyāṃ saṃvidi yor'tho bhāsate sā tatra pramāṇam /
analyzed: yasyām saṃvidi yaḥ arthaḥ bhāsate sā tatra pramāṇam
translated: That cognition in which an object shines is the means of knowing it.

original: ekapadamiti buddhau varṇā eva sphuranti nātiriktasphoṭa iti na sā sphoṭe pramāṇamityāhana /
analyzed: eka padam iti buddhau varṇāḥ eva sphuranti na atirikta sphoṭaḥ iti na sā sphoṭe pramāṇam iti āha
translated: In the cognition of the word one, only the letters appear, not an additional sphoṭa. Therefore that cognition is not a means of knowing the sphoṭa. He says No, etc.

original: asyā apītyādinā /🔽nanu gopadabuddheḥ sphoṭo viṣayo gakārādīnāṃ tu vyañjakatvādanuvṛttirityata āhayadi hīti /
analyzed: asyāḥ api ityādinā  nanu go pada buddheḥ sphoṭaḥ viṣayaḥ gakāra ādīnām tu vyañjaka tvāt anuvṛttiḥ iti atas āha yadi hi iti
translated: By this also, etc.🔽But the object of the cognition of the word cow is the sphoṭa, while the letters are the manifesters, so there is recurrence. To this he says If, etc.

analyzed: vyaṅgya vahni buddhau vyañjaka dhūma anuvṛtteḥ adarśanāt iti arthaḥ
translated: Because the recurrence of the manifestor smoke is not seen in the cognition of the manifest fire. This is the meaning.

analyzed: varṇa samūha ālambana tva upapattaiḥ na sphoṭaḥ kalpanīyaḥ  padārtha antara kalpanā gauravāt iti āha tasmāt iti
translated: The sphoṭa should not be imagined as having as its object a collection of letters, because it is not established.🔽And because of the difficulty of postulating a different meaning, he says therefore.

analyzed: anekasya api aupādhikam eka tvam yuktam iti āha saṃbhavati iti
translated: It is proper to consider the oneness of many as adventitious. He says it is possible.

analyzed: nanu tatra eka deśa ādi rūpādhiḥ asti
translated: But there is an adventitious entity like a part there.

original: prakṛte ka upādhirityata āhayā tviti /🔽ekārthe śaktamekaṃ padaṃ /

translated: What is the adventitious entity in the present case? To this he says but.🔽A word is capable of expressing one meaning.

analyzed: pradhāna arthe ekasmin tātparyavat ekam vākyam iti ekārtha saṃbandhāt ekatva upacāraḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: A sentence is one whose purport is in one principal meaning. Thus, the figurative use of oneness is due to the relation of oneness of meaning. This is the meaning.

analyzed: na ca eka pada tve jñāte eka artha jñānam
translated: And when the oneness of a word is known, the knowledge of one meaning is not.

analyzed: asmin jñāte tat iti anyonya āśrayaḥ iti vācyam
translated: When this is known, that is. This is a mutual dependence. This should not be said.

analyzed: uttama vṛddha uktānām varṇānām krameṇa antya varṇa śravaṇa anantaram bālasya eka smṛti ārūḍhānām madhyama vṛddhasya pravṛtti ādi liṅga anumita eka artha dhī hetu tva niścaye
translated: After hearing the last letter in the sequence of letters spoken by the best elder, the child has the certainty that they are the cause of the cognition of one meaning inferred by the activity etc. of the middle elder, who has the certainty that they are the cause of the cognition of one meaning.

analyzed: sati eka pada vākya tva niścayāt

analyzed: varṇa sāmye pi pada bheda dṛṣṭeḥ varṇa atiriktam padam sphoṭa ākhyam aṅgīkāryam iti śaṅkate atra āha iti
translated: Even when the letters are the same, the difference of words is seen. Therefore, a word called sphoṭa, which is different from the letters, should be accepted. He doubts this with the word here.

analyzed: karma bhedāt varṇeṣu eva pada bheda dṛṣṭiḥ iti pariharati atra iti
translated: To this he replies: In this case, the difference in words is seen only in the different castes due to the difference in actions.

analyzed: tatra āha vṛddha iti

analyzed: sthāyi varṇa vādam upasaṃharati varṇa iti

analyzed: dṛṣṭam varṇānām artha bodhaka tvam
